title: Electronic CVT System
description: Designed and built an electronic continuously variable transmission (eCVT) for a Baja SAE off-road vehicle, implementing position sensing, motor control, and PID-based actuation.
details: This project involved creating a complete electronic control system for a CVT, replacing the traditional mechanical actuation with a motor-driven lead screw system. The system uses an ESP32 microcontroller to read engine RPM via a hall sensor with embedded magnets, measure sheave position using both a linear potentiometer (for initialization) and motor encoder (for operation), and control a brushless DC motor with PID feedback. The electronics are housed in a custom waterproof enclosure mounted on the vehicle frame. The design required careful motor selection (achieving 3+ Nm torque at 150+ RPM), battery sizing for endurance (40Ah LiFePO4), and integration with the existing drivetrain.
